channel.title: Modifying
channel.description: I am trying to give the ice queen five thousand hp, yet when i change it in the npc.cfg file, it doesn't seem to help at all, so I was wondering if anybody could tell me how to actually make her max hp 5000.

item.title: Modifying
item.dc:creator: @skiller_noob1 skiller noob1
item.description:
@skiller_noob1 wrote:

You have to wait, until the experts get here, then you may get a valid answer.

Read full topic

item.title: Modifying
item.dc:creator: @Narubia Narubia
item.description:
@Narubia wrote:

Ok, this thread it about giving me the solution to my problem, not for any of you to try and prove you are better than anyone else, either help me or gtfo.

Read full topic

item.title: Modifying
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“Mrs Extro Limited, post:8, topic:235400”][quote author=x blitz x link=topic=310451.msg2478383#msg2478383 date=1223402275]

Ever heard of compiling your source?

.CFG files do not need compiling. Just restart the source after you edit one.

Vic, .CFG’s arent compiled…

LOL! okay try adding something into a autospawn and don’t compile then see what happens.

He’s correct. So i would leave before you embarrass yourself even more.
[/quote]
Ye okay better had…
No I wont.
DO COMPILE in some sort of way.
in your npchandler it loads the autospawn.cfg that means when you compile something after editing autospawn it saves into the server npchandler.class that makes it work.[/quote]

No, everytime the server restarts the NPCHandler class reloads the .CFG files with the updates, so you do not need to compile.

Learn something then reply. Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Modifying
item.dc:creator: @Narubia Narubia
item.description:
@Narubia wrote:

So, anyone with an actual answer gonna help me?

.CFG files do not need compiling. Just restart the source after you edit one.

Ye okay better had…
No I wont.
DO COMPILE in some sort of way.
in your npchandler it loads the autospawn.cfg that means when you compile something after editing autospawn it saves into the server npchandler.class that makes it work.
